result.rationale: Barilius naseeri is endemic to the Punjab Province, Pakistan, where it occurs within a limited distribution range in the Soan and Jhelum Rivers. The species has an extent of occurrence (EOO) of 8,000 km2 and an area of occupancy (AOO) of 1,300 km2. Considered to be rare, the species is under threat from a range of anthropogenic stressors prevalent in the river systems where it occurs. There are two locations based on these threats. Therefore, B. naseeri is assessed as Vulnerable.
result.geographicrange: Barilius naseeri is endemic to the Punjab Province, Pakistan (Mirza and Mirza 2014). Since its description from River Soan near Pindighaip, Attock District (Mirza et al. 1986), it has been recorded from the Jhelum River at the Jhelum Bridge (Mirza et al. 2011).
result.population: The species is rare, but no data are available regarding the population size or trend for this species.
result.habitat: This is an omnivorous species. It is a surface feeder and occurs in freshwater streams with sandy beds (Mirza 2003).
result.threats: Threats to this species include urban expansion and pollution (Mirza et al. 2011) but the severity and scope of such threats are unknown.
result.conservationmeasures: There are no species-specific conservation action plans in place. The species is not found in any protected area.
result.usetrade: The species is not in use or trade.
